qas.question: What system was used previous to the ASA system?

answers.text: the system of Weston film speed ratings

qas.question: Who devised the Weston film speed ratings?

answers.text: Edward Faraday Weston (1878–1971) and his father Dr. Edward Weston (1850–1936)

qas.question: What company did Dr. Edward Weston start?

answers.text: the US-based Weston Electrical Instrument Corporation

qas.question: When was the Weston model 617 created?
Who is credited with creating the film and meter system?
When was the ASA system introduced?
When was William Nelson Goodwin Jr. born?
What medal did Edward Faraday Weston win?

plausible_answers.text: the system of Weston film speed ratings

qas.question: What did Howard N. Potts invent in 1932?

context: Before the advent of the ASA system, <a0_0><b9_0>the system of Weston film speed ratings<b9_0/><a0_0/> was introduced by <a1_0><b5_0>Edward Faraday Weston<b5_0/> (<b7_0>1878<b7_0/>–1971) and his father Dr. Edward Weston (1850–1936)<a1_0/>, a British-born electrical engineer, industrialist and founder of <a2_0>the US-based Weston Electrical Instrument Corporation<a2_0/>, with the Weston model 617, one of the earliest photo-electric exposure meters, in <a3_0><b6_0>August 1932<b6_0/><a3_0/>. The meter and film rating system were invented by <a4_0>William Nelson Goodwin, Jr.<a4_0/>, who worked for them and later received a <b8_0>Howard N. Potts Medal<b8_0/> for his contributions to engineering.
